pros: Very welcoming and positive environment, teamwork, great education and HR representatives. A great place to work!
cons: Distance from my home, but other than that, I like everything so far.

review_title: The best place to grow and nurture your career!
pros: Conway Medical Center is a very family oriented facility. The work environment is very nurturing and your coworkers genuinely look out for each other. The facility is constantly growing so there are always multiple opportunities to expand your career.  Nursing leadership is always readily available and open to feedback.
cons: Pay increases to staff who have been employed with the facility are minimal. Longevity and loyalty to the company is not rewarded monetarily on a competitive level.

review_title: Tele, PCU, Medical, Surgical, Cath Lab
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Conway, SC
pros: Very accepting of travelers; large, clean units. Critical care unit very large compared to some hospitals I've seen. Separate medical unit from surgical unit. Nurse ratio 1:5 on tele/med/surg. Equipment in adequate supply, regularly serviced and maintained. Good moral. Most units work great as a team and help each other freely and willingly. Cafeteria actually has great food!
cons: Limited in interventional procedures performed on site (i.e. CABG). WOW computers need some updates/maintenece.

review_title: Good Place to Work with bright future
pros: At my level and role, I have excellent access to executive leadership and strategic planning processes. Leadership is open to patient-centric ideas regardless of area of expertise. At least in my experience, leadership also allows subject area leaders/experts a generous amount of autonomy to accomplish organizational goals. On the nursing side, CMC has the best nurse-to-patient ratio in the area. Generous benefits and retirement package. Employees get a 60% discount on medical care.
cons: Communication across the organization is poor. Both from a high level down and inter-departmentally. Culturally developing, there are still many mid-level leaders who struggle to adapt to change. Small team sizes in non-clinical areas lead to overburdened staff. Lack of accountability in some areas for when things don't work.

pros: plenty of overtime if wanted
cons: some departments treated better than others

review_title: I tried the rest and now work at the BEST.
pros: Great benefits Onboarding process is easy and HR staff is very helpful On-site cafeteria with healthy options On-site gym (free) with classes and personal training (free) Caring co-workers and feeling like part of a family Near the beach
cons: Summer traffic can make the commute to and from the beach a bit longer than normal

pros: CMC takes the time to listen to their teams needs. Administration truly takes the time to look at all aspects to ensure that each person at CMC is valued. Leaders take time to listen and take into account the overall Vision. Taking care of our staff , so we can provide the very best and compassionate cate to our community.
cons: I have nothing negative to say about CMC

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Conway, SC
pros: Not bad laid back no big issues. Can be clicks but what job doesn’t. Stay to self you’ll be fine.
cons: Not a lot of structure from hr they are too laid back in comparison to other area hospitals.let alot of things go unnoticed.

cons: I truly have no cons to express.

pros: Good benefits package at an affordable price. They have to do this since salaries are low.
cons: Low pay compared to competitors. Good old boys network is alive and thriving. Board of Directors and upper management almost all old white men, not reflective of community served. Inconsistent application of policies. Years behind the rest of the world in technology and software systems.

job_title: Physical Therapist in Little River, SC
pros: I enjoy the work, my personal boss is fair, and you can't beat the weather in SC.
cons: Good Ole Boy Network is in charge and they are easily offended by new ideas and women wearing pants. Health care is hard, and they are not making it any easier. Best to put up and shut up. If you can live with that, you'll do great here.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Conway, SC
pros: Friendly coworkers and low aquity
cons: Low pay compared to surrounding hospitals

pros: Hourly pay was above average after 8 years with them.
cons: Typical hospital behavior. Nurses drowning in way too much work in order to keep budgets down. Too much responsibility for a job with no room for error. Meanwhile, President/CEO was banking close to 2 million a year. Health insurance is expensive for a group plan and not very good coverage. My dentist laughed at the dental plan, said he hadn't seen that low amount of coverage since the 80's.

job_title: Medical Office Assistant in Conway, SC
pros: Benefits are good. Love the health insurance.
cons: Management is terrible. You will be under payed and given no incentive to go above and beyond.

pros: Its a great place to work, benifits are good, and they do nice things to show appreciatio
cons: low pay, always short staff and alot of miscommunication

pros: Friendly staff. Community oriented, great place for entry level

pros: Routine pay evaluation, clear cut rules, steady patient base.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Conway, SC
pros: Not sure that I can find any to tell about, other than the few amazing people you may encounter to work with each day for almost 3 hrs.   The  physicians, NP's and other staff members in the clinic were outstanding. The problem however was the new and most recent administrators.   If you had a "strong team of good workers", you were perceived to have been "an issue" and were treated with rudeness and condescension, because you WERE a great employee, maybe too great,
cons: The  physicians, NP's and other staff members in the clinic were outstanding. The problem however was the new and most recent administrators.   If you had a "strong team of good workers", you were perceived to have been "an issue" and were treated with rudeness and condescension, because you WERE a great employee, maybe too great, thereby causing the less than desirable team members to be put in the spotlight.  Some managers were complete and total liars, as well as having "questionable backgrounds", that would seem impervious for some of your senior nursing personnel to even pass the background checks

job_title: Operating Room RN in Conway, SC
pros: Patient focused, treats employees with respect and value everyone. Great friendly atmosphere and really care about providing Excellent care to their patients.
cons: Less than average pay; Their pay is less than other local hospitals as a whole. The on call pay rate there hasn't changed in 20 years; $2.00 an hour.. They offer 403 retirement instead of 401 k. Some areas of specialty do not get recognized or compensated/paid specialty pay like other hospitals do.

pros: Great co-workers, Always welcoming. Friendly Place with Friendly people..Their Benefit Manager is Awesome.
cons: Pay is average to low end. Favoritism is obvious. Everyone knows everyone. Things get overlooked that definitely shouldn't be; policy and procedures are broken alot. Why? Upper Management (Supervisors) positions are held by people that have been there for years, promoted; Friends.  Difficult situation?

pros: Great boss. Fairly accommodating with schedule. Small hospital with a small town feeling where everyone gets to know everyone.
cons: Benefits not that great and you can only use in-hospital pharmacy which is not convenient for people who work overnight.
